# Beer Description

A truly authentic Belgian style wheat or "white" ale, this Rascal is unfiltered (yup, that's yeast on the bottom) and cleverly spiced with coriander and Curacao orange peel producing a refreshingly fruity thirst quencher.

# What you should know

Witbiers (from the Belgian word for "white") are one of the most traditional Belgian styles, and didn't begin to become popular in the US until the introduction of Blue Moon (by Miller Coors, ironically) in the early 2000s. The Curacao orange hails from the island of the same name (actually a part of the Dutch kingdom) and its peel has been used in the last century to spice up Belgian whites. This variety of orange is actually way too bitter to eat, but the pungency of its peel makes for a great counter-balance to the soft, wheat-y malt of the beer.

# The Boys' Take

This is soft and citrusy and a little heavier than some other white beers. This is what we would say is just pleasant to drink- almost velvet in the mouth and sweet to the tongue.

# About the Brewer

Adam Avery started Avery Brewery in 1993 in Boulder, CO. It was bold at the time to open a brewery, and Avery started small. However, now today is established solidly as a quality brewer out of the brewery mecca of Denver/Boulder. Avery is committed to making original beer‚Ä¶ and not just what everybody wants. This means that it hasn't had the same commercial success, but also means it gets to keep a solid reputation with the experts. Some of the best aggressive beers come from here- especially the seasonal Dictator series- which contains traditional classic styles on steroids. If like a drop-kick to the face of fresh hops in the springtime, check out The Maharaja- an Imperial IPA.

# Drink this if You Like

Unfiltered beer, Belgians, wheat beer

# Ideal for People who Like

Citrusy drinks, comfort-down mattresses, playful devils

# Drink While You Are

Kicking back with an orange slice, up to some minor mischief

# Pair With

Spicy food such as thai or Mexican, blackened fish, ceviche

# Beer Description

We‚Äôve kicked it up a notch by adding a tropical twist to this refreshing ale. Get amped on Passion Fruit Kicker‚Äîa jaw-dropping, mouth-watering, smooth brew with sweet, tart, fruity flavor. We layer passion fruit tea and passion fruit juice with wheat malt and 2-row malted barley to bring you this exhilarating crowd pleaser. Your palate will do a 360 for more of this luscious wheat ale. Appearance‚ÄîHazy pale yellow with white beer foam. Aroma‚ÄîPassion fruit pungency and fruit Belgian yeast esters similar to bubblegum. Flavor‚ÄîFlavor has a prominent sweet tart passion fruit character that mingles with the Belgian fruit bowl esters. Note: This is different than the previous beer under this name which was a higher gravity ipa with brett blended with a wine barrel aged beer.

# The Boys‚Äô Take

Light and crisp with just a hint of passion fuit zip. It‚Äôs the perfect summer brew if you‚Äôre looking for something just a little different!

# About the Brewer

Husband and wife team Mike and Lisa Hinkley lead Green Flash, and have since starting the brewery in 2002.  Located in San Diego, they were one of the pioneers of the ‚Äúwest coast‚Äù style which has led to an explosion of flavor and aggression in San Diego and San Francisco (and now LA!).  In many ways, Green Flash (along with Stone and Lagunitas) is responsible for the flavor revolution.  So that‚Äôs that.  Nowadays, Green Flash continues to make quality, mostly hop-forward beers, included some like the Palate Wrecker and the Green Bullet Triple IPA (not even sure what that means!)

Wheats, Wits, Whites, Golden Ales

# Beer Description

Otra Vez means ‚Äúanother time,‚Äù and for Sierra Nevada that time is early California when beers were made from local ingredients. The brewery trialed various native produce searching for great flavors. Prickly pear cactus flourishes in the state‚Äôs arid deserts, and grapefruit fills the Central Valley‚Äôs flats. Together their fruity-tangy blend makes Otra Vez, whose tartness is true to the gose style, pop with character.

# What you should know

Gose are sour beers that originated in Goslar, Germany- the style started in the 16th Century, but almost went extinct during WWII!  The style is brewed using salt and coriander and often has a lemony flavor.  Super refreshing.  The addition of the blood orange in this one not only gives Anderson Valley‚Äôs Gose more citrus, but also a tangy Orange flavor. 

# The Boy‚Äôs Take

Not as tart or salty as your typical gose but light and effervescent with a touch of Prickly pear sweet citrus. Excited about having this available poolside this summer!

# About the Brewer

The third-largest craft brewer in the US, Sierra Nevada has proven that it belongs at the very top of the rankings since 1980.  From the beginning, Sierra Nevada beer has been a celebration of spicy American hops, and they‚Äôve never backed down from that.  And they‚Äôve earned their upper-tier position by forging a path that in 1980 barely existed.  Hops were hard to find.  Brewery equipment didn‚Äôt come on a micro scale.  Then they came up with the Pale Ale, which was instrumental in bringing the West Coast style to the mainstream.  Finally in 1987, Sierra Nevada moved into downtown Chico and setup shop.  Now they are a N. California fixture and also have a brewery in the works in Asheville, NC.  To this day, Sierra Nevada is still synonymous with hoppy, fresh beer, and we hope that never changes.

# Drink this if You Like

Goses, Lactobacillus-based beers, Wheat beer

# Ideal for People who Like

Prickly Pear, San Pelegrino, friendly bacteria

# Drink While You Are

Looking for crisp, cool refreshment, enjoying a late Spring brunch

# Pair With

Smoked Salmon, Oysters, Pad Thai, Bitter Greens

# Beer Description

Our Blood Orange Gose is a tart, refreshing wheat ale that is kettle-soured with lactobacillus and brewed with sea salt and coriander. However, unlike traditional versions of the style, ours features liberal additions of blood oranges during fermentation. This imparts tangy citrus notes that complement the champagne-like flavors, creating a complex and sessionable ale perfect for any occasion.

# What You Need To Know

Gose are sour beers that originated in Goslar, Germany- the style started in the 16th Century, but almost went extinct during WWII!  The style is brewed using salt and coriander and often has a lemony flavor.  Super refreshing.  The addition of the blood orange in this one not only gives Anderson Valley‚Äôs Gose more citrus, but also a tangy Orange flavor. 

# The Boys' Take

So you a fan of this whole sour thing, huh?  You can‚Äôt go wrong with this one!  Tart. Refreshing.  It‚Äôs sour, but not really funky- more tangy and really not that salty.  

# About the Brewer

Ahh, Anderson Valley, in beautiful, pastoral Booneville, CA, using solarpower and pixie-dust to create some of the best-drinking, smoothest ales around.  The original brewery was in the basement of a brewpub run by Ken Allen, and beer operations started in earnest way back in 1987.  After really killing it for a few years, Ken moved to a huge, gleaming brewhouse in the middle of nowhere in Northern Cali.  Well, in 2010 Ken did retire, leaving the company to Trey White, who partnered with brewmaster Fal Allen (no relation to Ken).  Since then Trey and Fal have taken Anderson Valley national and jumped whole-heartedly into seasonal and barrel-aging scene.  Try the Hop Ottin IPA and the Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout

# Like

Goses, Lactobacillus-based beers, Wheat beer

# Ideal for People who Like

Blood oranges, San Pelegrino, friendly bacteria

# Drink While You Are

Looking for crisp, cool refreshment, enjoying a late Spring brunch

alcohol.label: https://untappd.akamaized.net/site/beer_logos/beer-25796_43b95_sm.jpeg
alcohol.description:
# Beer Description

Way smooth and silky with a nice wheaty-esque-ish-ness. Just the little sumpin' sumpin' we all need to kick Summer into full swing!

# What you should know

Depending on who you ask, A Little Sumpin Sumpin is either an wheat ale or an IPA. It's an pale wheat ale with enough hops to please your inner hop head.

# The Boys' Take

When we drink this one, we taste straight grapefruit. It's wheaty, sure, but always surprisingly dry and bitter and just a little bit sour.

# About the Brewer

The Lagunitas Brewing Company is a brewery founded in 1993 in Lagunitas, California. They are known for iconoclastic interpretations of traditional beer styles, and irreverent descriptive text and stories on their packaging. The company is the fifth top selling craft brewery in the US, and has a very strong lineup of beers in all styles. It's rare to find one that you won't like. Try especially the Sonoma Farmhouse Hop Stoopid, a spicy Double IPA and the ironically-named Lagunitas Sucks.

# Drink this if You Like

West Coast IPAs, Pale Ales, Wheat Ales

# Ideal for People who Like

Grapefruit, that little sumthin, summer

# Drink While You Are

Waking up onthose Saturday summer mornings

# Pair With

Saffron, scallops, veggies, sushi, fruit salad, halibut, chips, mozzarella

alcohol.name: Milk Stout
alcohol.label: https://untappd.akamaized.net/site/beer_logos/beer-5445_61c13_sm.jpeg
alcohol.description:
# Beer Description

A traditional full-bodied stout brewed with lactose (milk sugar). The subtle sweetness imparted by the lactose balances the sharpness of the highly roasted grains which give this delicious beer its black color.

# What you should know

Milk stouts are made using lactose, which is a sugar undigestable by beer yeast. This leaves a lot more sugar than usual in the beer, giving it a richer taste and feel than some other beers. Milk stouts are typically lighter on the malts than others to compensate for this.

# The Boys' Take

A beer milkshake? Yes, please! Although it is sweet, the Duck Rabbit Milk Stout is well balanced, and carries along some rich coffee and chocolate taste along its smooth, smooth ride. Have it on nitro for true mouth-jazz.

# About the Brewer

Paul Philippon was teaching Philosophy in North Carolina when he began thinking about the meaning of life. After pondering that for a long time, he realized that this was a very complex subject- so he decided to drink beer instead. And thus his love of beer grew, until, suddenly, Paul was ready to brew beer. And thus became The Duck-Rabbit Brewery in Farmville, NC. What is a Duck-Rabbit, you might ask? Well, take a look at the distinctive logo for this brewery. Do you see a Duck or a Rabbit? A rabbit or a duck? Think about it. And then think about what your answer says about you. Honestly, we have no idea, but D-R makes some great, award-winning beer. They are mostly traditional styles, but we say go for the Milk Stout, the Rabid Duck Russian Imperial or the Baltic Porter for the most bang for your buck.

# Drink this if You Like

Sweet porters and browns, milk stouts

# Ideal for People who Like

Cream in the their coffee, Chocolate milk

# Drink While You Are

Ready for a nap, satisfying your sweet tooth

# Pair With

Bread pudding, chocolate, cheesecake, pork tenderloin, glazed veggies, roasted veggies

alcohol.name: Dirty Bastard
alcohol.label: https://untappd.akamaized.net/site/beer_logos/beer-1013_bac4c_sm.jpeg
alcohol.description:
# Beer Description

Founders flagship beer. Dirty Bastard is an absolute beautiful beer to behold. Dark ruby in color and brewed with ten varieties of imported malts this beer continuously lives up to its reputation as a bold and powerful ale. Dirty Bastard is complex in the finish with hints of smoke and peat paired with a malty richness, finalized with a good bit of hop attitude. This beer "ain't fer the wee lads"

# The Boy's Take

Obviously, today Founder's is one of the most successful craft breweries in America, and it all started with this beer. It's sorta in its own category, with anise and toffee flavors, and then of course the flavor of peat. The alcohol flavor is pretty strong with this one, so watch out if you're not a fan of dark liquor

# About the Brewer

Founder's Brewery is the pride and joy of Grand Rapids, MI. Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers started the brewery, and very quickly they realized they were running out of money- so they decided to stop playing it safe. Since then, Founder's has been a different brewery. This isn't the place that has crazy names or themes. The names are simple, but the beer can be complex. Check out the Breakfast Stout in the winter and the Harvest Ale in fall.

# Drink this if You Like

Stouts, rich, boozy ales

# Ideal for People who Like

Grab-bags, angry Scottish men, variety in flavors

# Drink While You Are

Preparing for a kilt-tilting contest

# Pair With

Salmon, smoked meat, brie, gouda, Havarti, swiss

# Beer Description

The beer you've been waiting for. Keeps your taste satisfied while keeping your senses sharp. An all-day IPA naturally brewed with a complex array of malts, grains and hops. Balanced for optimal aromatic and a clean finish. The perfect reward for an honest day's work and the ultimate companion to celebrate life's simple pleasures.

# What you should know

Session IPAs are some of the most difficult beers to create, because lower ABV means lower malt, which means that the flavor of hops can become hard to mask. As much as the hopheads might say it, nobody munches on hop buds, and there's a reason for that. But Founder's Brewmaster Jeremy Kosmicki wanted a beer he could drink a decent amount of but still have flavor. So he created All-Day IPA, a beer with all the IPA flavor, but still plenty of pound-ability. That's All-Day IPA

# The Boys' Take

Refreshing as all get out and great for a summer day, the focus that we tasted here is a bit of hops, with light body and taste. It has enough hoppiness to keep us happy, but is light enough for the hottest day.

# About the Brewer

Founder's Brewery is the pride and joy of Grand Rapids, MI. Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers started the brewer, and very quickly they realized they were running out of money- so they decided to stop playing it safe. Since then, Founder's has been a different brewery. This isn't the place that has crazy names or themes. The names are simple, but the beer can be complex. Check out the Breakfast Stout in the winter and the Harvest Ale in fall.

# Drink this if You Like

Session IPAs, Pale Ales, IPAs

# Ideal for People who Like

Getting out there, an active lifestyle, day-drinking

# Drink While You Are

Canoeing, road-tripping (as long as you aren't driving)

# Pair with

Mexican, Enchiladas, Hamburgers

# Beer Description

Abita Wrought Iron IPA embodies the resilient, indestructible nature of New Orleans. This India pale ale is forged with the intensity of Apollo, Equinox and Mosaic Hops. Brewed with pale ale malt for a golden color as bright as iron from a fiery forge.

# The Boys'

Take: A bolder style beer then you would typically expect from the folks at Abita. Wrought Iron is an IPA with enough strong hop bitterness to live up to its name. A really excellent IPA from the folks at Abita.

# About the Brewer

Abita was founded in 1986, and is in many ways the quintessential Southern beer. Brewed in Abita Springs, LA (40 minutes north of New Orleans), Abita makes a wide range of brews, some of which are perfect for pairing with seersucker and sticky nights- and that's something we need here in the South. Another added benefit is the pure, deep water from Abita Springs- this is the last little bit that kicks Abita beer "up a notch!" Most Abita beers are light drinking and perfect for summer nights, and are made with all-natural, high-quality ingredients.

# Drink this if You Like

Pale Ales, IPAs, Double IPAs

# Ideal for People who Like

New Orleans, front porches and ceiling fans, grits

# Drinking While you Are

Wrassling a gator, on a boat, done with some yardwork

# Pair with

Gumbo, Jambalaya, Low Country Boil, Crawfish Etouffee

# Beer Description

Abita Turbodog is a dark brown ale brewed with Willamette hops and a combination of British pale, crystal and chocolate malts. This combination gives Turbodog its rich body and color and a sweet chocolate-toffee like flavor.

# What you Need to Know

The Turbodog was actually originally released as a special brew, but popular response was so positive Abita decided to keep it around full-time

# The Boy's Take

(In slow jam voice) This one's smooooth baby.   The taste you' re going to get here is almost entirely malts, and those malts roll nicely on the tongue.    It ' s not super sweet, just the taste of delicious barley.

# About the Brewer

Brewed in Abita Springs, LA (40 minutes north of New Orleans), Abita makes a wide range of brews, some of which are perfect for pairing with seersucker and sticky nights- and that's something we need here in the South.  Another added benefit is the pure, deep water from Abita Springs- this is the last little bit that kicks Abita beer "up a notch!"  Most Abita beers are light drinking and perfect for summer nights, and are made with all-natural, high-quality ingredients.

# Drink this if You Like

Brown ales, Porters

# Ideal for People who Like

Jambalaya, Brits at Mardi Gras, Dogs with Jetpacks

# Drinking While you Are

Seducing someone (we have been watching a lot of The Americans recently although no, they don't usually use beer to seduce their victims)

# Pair with

Meat generally, sausage, smoked fish, as a marinade or braise, chocolate

# Beer Description

Abita Purple Haze is a crisp, American style wheat beer with fresh raspberries added during secondary fermentation. Subtle coloration, fruity aroma and tartly sweet taste.

# What you Need to Know

This beer is a lager, meaning is fermented with lager yeast and kept cold (45-50 degrees) during fermentation. This keeps the flavors crisp and clear (instead of influences by other flavors in the air). The raspberries are added after the beer is bottled.

# About the Brewer

Abita was founded in 1986, and is in many ways the quintessential Southern beer. Brewed in Abita Springs, LA (40 minutes north of New Orleans), Abita makes a wide range of brews, some of which are perfect for pairing with seersucker and sticky nights- and that's something we need here in the South. Another added benefit is the pure, deep water from Abita Springs- this is the last little bit that kicks Abita beer "up a notch!" Most Abita beers are light drinking and perfect for summer nights, and are made with all-natural, high-quality ingredients.

# Drink this if You Like

Smooth lagers, sweet/tangy beer

# Ideal for People who Like

Louisiana, raspberries, Jimmy Hendricks, Seer sucker

# Drinking While you Are

Boogying, or at a hoedown

# Pair with

Salad, light dessert, chocolate, Brie, mascarpone, citrus
